comment.author: 41133925@N02
comment._content: The aeroplane is an RE8. One of the most numerous observation types in service with the RFC.

comment.author: 31324280@N02
comment._content:
Tempting to think it is from the same squadron as in this image (similar aircraft with squadron code number 1 A - the above looks to be 4 A):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4700046399/in/set-72157624150609895/]

comment.author: 43335486@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Flickr United (Award 3), and we'd love to have this added to the group! amazing historic stream! Bravo

comment.author: 46578314@N07
comment._content: Congratulations!!! You have been awarded a “Flickr United” Medal! If you haven't done so, please add your photo to: Flickr United Please tag your photo: FlickrUnitedAward

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: RAF markings can clearly be seen on the fuselage, wings and tail of the biplane, which looks like a Bristol F-2. This is a Royal Aircraft Factory RE-8 two-seater reconnaissance plane. The same machine as seen on the posed picture of the two man looking at a map. Kees
